channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: In Search of a Few Good Rock Stars
item.description: This major firm is located in Houston, Texas, but donâ€™t worry if youâ€™re not a local. They have a top-rate relocation program because finding talent matters to them. And what do they do once theyâ€™ve found the celebrities of the programming world? They take care of them, thatâ€™s what!

item.title: Wanted: Junior Perl Developer Ready to Move Up from the Bunny Hill
item.description: The client helps charities fund raise online and manages online payment systems for landlords, so youâ€™ll have the satisfaction of knowing youâ€™re contributing to the greater good. And if thatâ€™s not enough for you, did we mention the annual company ski trip AND the chance to work in the mountains near Lake Geneva for a week each year, all expenses paid? Giving back never felt so good!

item.title: All in the Family - Perl developer in Central Manchester
item.description: The client is a family business for the modern age, 100% owned by the founders and directors. Their mission is to match flatmates to flatshares because after all, you canâ€™t live at Mumâ€™s forever. Theyâ€™re looking for someone with a great attitude and a passion for collaborationâ€”basically, someone who plays nice with the other kids and shares their toys.

item.description: Ryan blog is always full of in-depth analysis of weekly task.

item.title: Octal Representation
item.description: Ryan has become very popular with his high quality contributions. Highly Recommended.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 42: Octal Numbers and Balanced Parentheses
item.description: Laurent do not need any introduction. If you are looking for analytical explanation then please do check out the blog.

item.description: Javier made Raku so simple that anyone can follow without any help. Highly Recommended.

item.description: Jaldhar has been missing for a while. He is back with a bang. Must Read.

item.description: Burkhard blog is unmissable for any Perl and Raku fan.

item.description: Arne shows off the power of Raku every week. Do checkout if you want to learn more about Raku.

item.description: A brilliant thought provoking blog by Flavio. Please checkout the blog to learn about Curses.

item.title: Think Raku - Released
item.description: Laurent announced updated version of original book "Think Perl6" but since Perl 6 has been renamed Raku, they have also changed the title of the book.

item.title: #442 - Fellowship of the Perl
item.description:
Hi there

Just a few days ago, I saw a tweet by Ruth Holloway announcing "Fellowship of the Perl". If you're interested in making Perl a better programming language and a better community, then join the group in founding the Fellowship by signing the Manifesto. You'll be subscribed to an email list, where we will set to work soon on the Code of Conduct and Ethics, and the Constitution and Bylaws documents.

The Perl and Raku Conference Registration is LIVE now. You can find more information here

This is my first edition of weekly newsletter of the year 2020. I hope you enjoy reading the newsletter. I wish you all a great week.
